OpenBMC CI build failed

@Rafi, you neeed to run clang-format -i for the files
Manually resolved merge conflicts from outstanding clang-format commit for you.
Looks good!

It appears I've provided improper guidance for unpacking the incoming NCSI response.
I've tried performing a web search for proper deserialization, and not seen a satisfactory answer.
Raw unpacking of C structs is not portable and leads to undefined behavior in both C and C++ standards.

I guess I'm learning something today.
What's the approved method for unpacking nl_data?
Removed the __attribute__((packed)) for the structures and extracted the data from the response using memmove
Resolved the review comments

Please implement the 'get' action following the paradigm here:
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-networkd/+/73149

Don't use raw C pointer.
This should be a C++ reference (i.e. `&`).
Don't use ntoh(x) here. The data passed in should already be in the correct endianess.

This doesn't look right to me either.
You're not taking into account the endianness of the payload.

I would expect some version of:
`paramResp.paramStatCode.completionCodeResponse = ntohs(*reinterpret_cast<uint16_t*>(*data));
data += sizeof(uint16_t);`
...
This meets the serialized unpack request, and eliminates all of the `if` handling.
